intro: Atalanthus capillaris, commonly known as the slender antelope's bean, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its hairy stems and narrow leaves are adapted to thrive in arid environments. Atalanthus capillaris is often found in sandy or rocky soils, showcasing its drought-tolerant nature.
